page.title: 11CROFTING
page.content: The crofter we interviewed told us that the croft has been in his family for 40 years.Altogether it covers 5 acres of land.He keeps no cattle but has some sheep,hens and a couple of dogs.He grows cabbages,oats,potatoes and hay.Crofting is not his full-time occupation.He works in Inverness and crofts part-time.Many of the people on neighbouring crofts do not work their land but rent it to one man who works several crofts as a small farm.As he has a larger area of land to work than one croft,he can afford to buy expensive equipment to help him. Registered crofts can only be owned by people who have a crofting background but in our area many people have applied to have crofts de-crofted so they can use them as dwelling houses.
